intro: Pavia lucida, commonly known as the shining pavia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes and produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or streamside habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in some botanical gardens and private collections.
